label: A2B_oP12_18_2c_c-001
title: $\gamma$-TeO$_{2}$ Structure ({\em Erroneous})
comments:
This structure, which we published in (Hicks, 2021), is in error.  We followed the text of (Champarnaud-Mesjard, 2000), which put this structure in space group $P2_12_12$ \#18.  In fact, the structure is in $P2_12_12_1$ \#19, as an examination of the figures in that paper demonstrate, and shows that $\gamma$-TeO$_{2}$ takes on the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_oP12_19_2a_a-002}{$\beta$-SnF$_{2}$} structure. 
 The ICSD entry for (Champarnaud-Mesjard, 2000), 90733, correctly identifies the space group for this structure. 
 We regret the error, but leave the structure in place as it has already been published. 
 In reality, TeO$_{2}$ has been observed in three different forms (Ceriotti, 2006; Liu, 2016): \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_tP12_92_b_a-002}{$\alpha$-TeO$_{2}$, paratellurite} is the ground state \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_oP24_61_2c_c-002}{$\beta$-TeO$_{2}$, tellurite} is stable under ambient conditions and is the most commonly observed phase \item $\gamma$-TeO$_{2}$ is metastable, and froms at 663K in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_oP12_19_2a_a-002}{$\beta$-SnF$_{2}$} structure. \end{itemize}
